verses.verse: Let him kiss <S%H5401><s%> me with the kisses <S%H5390><s%> of his mouth <S%H6310><s%>; For thy love <S%H1730><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than wine <S%H3196><s%>.

Thine oils <S%H8081><s%> have a goodly <S%H2896><s%> fragrance <S%H7381><s%>; Thy name <S%H8034><s%> is as oil <S%H8081><s%> poured forth <S%H7324><s%>; Therefore do the virgins <S%H5959><s%> love thee <S%H157><s%>.

Draw <S%H4900><s%> me <S%H7323><s%>; we will run after <S%H310><s%> thee <S%H4428><s%>: The king hath brought <S%H935><s%> me into his chambers <S%H2315><s%>; We will be glad <S%H1523><s%> and rejoice <S%H8055><s%> in thee <S%H2142><s%>; We will make mention of thy love <S%H1730><s%> more than of wine <S%H3196><s%>: Rightly <S%H4339><s%> do they love thee <S%H157><s%>.

I am black <S%H7838><s%>, but comely <S%H5000><s%>, Oh ye daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, As the tents <S%H168><s%> of Kedar <S%H6938><s%>, As the curtains <S%H3407><s%> of Solomon <S%H8010><s%>.

Look <S%H7200><s%> not upon me <S%H7840><s%>, because I am swarthy, Because the sun <S%H8121><s%> hath scorched <S%H7805><s%> me <S%H517><s%>. My mother's sons <S%H1121><s%> were incensed <S%H2787><s%> against me <S%H7760><s%>; They made me keeper <S%H5201><s%> of the vineyards <S%H3754><s%>; But mine own vineyard <S%H3754><s%> have I not kept <S%H5201><s%>.

Tell <S%H5046><s%> me <S%H5315><s%>, O thou whom my soul loveth <S%H157><s%>, Where <S%H349><s%> thou feedest <S%H7462><s%> thy flock <S%H349><s%>, Where thou makest it to rest <S%H7257><s%> at noon <S%H6672><s%>: For <S%H4100><s%> why should I be as one that is veiled Beside the flocks <S%H5739><s%> of thy companions <S%H2270><s%>?

If thou know <S%H3045><s%> not <S%H3303><s%>, O thou fairest among women <S%H802><s%>, Go thy way forth <S%H3318><s%> by the footsteps <S%H6119><s%> of the flock <S%H6629><s%>, And feed <S%H7462><s%> thy kids <S%H1429><s%> beside the shepherds <S%H7462><s%>' tents <S%H4908><s%>.
I have compared <S%H1819><s%> thee <S%H7474><s%>, O my love, To a steed <S%H5484><s%> in Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>'s chariots <S%H7393><s%>.
Thy cheeks <S%H3895><s%> are comely <S%H4998><s%> with plaits <S%H8447><s%> of hair <S%H6677><s%>, Thy neck with strings of jewels <S%H2737><s%>.
We will make <S%H6213><s%> thee plaits <S%H8447><s%> of gold <S%H2091><s%> With studs <S%H5351><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%>.
While the king <S%H4428><s%> sat at his table <S%H4524><s%>, My spikenard <S%H5373><s%> sent forth <S%H5414><s%> its fragrance <S%H7381><s%>.
My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is unto me as a bundle <S%H6872><s%> of myrrh <S%H4753><s%>, That lieth <S%H3885><s%> betwixt my breasts <S%H7699><s%>.
My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is unto me as a cluster <S%H811><s%> of henna-flowers <S%H3724><s%> In the vineyards <S%H3754><s%> of En-gedi <S%H5872><s%>.
Behold <S%H3303><s%>, thou art fair, my love <S%H7474><s%>; Behold thou art fair <S%H3303><s%>; Thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> are as doves <S%H3123><s%>.
Behold <S%H3303><s%>, thou art fair, my beloved <S%H1730><s%>, yea <S%H5273><s%>, pleasant: Also our couch <S%H6210><s%> is green <S%H7488><s%>.
The beams <S%H6982><s%> of our house <S%H1004><s%> are cedars <S%H730><s%>, And our rafters <S%H7351><s%> are firs <S%H1266><s%>.
